Portal 1 feels like a techdemo for Portal 2. It's much shorter and in Portal 2 some mechanics were replaced with faster and better ones. You also feel the Half-Life texture style in this one. Still it's a fun 2-3 hour first play through and after that maybe you play it again but much faster or try the challenges a bit, but you mostly move on to Portal 2.

This is a great puzzle game that you can get for cheap for almost every Steam sale time. Really challenges your brain in a fun, desolate way.  There are fun bonus modes to test you! Originally played this on The Orange Box, loved it.

When my friends ask me what my favorite game of all time is they always expect me to say either one of the Witcher games, or Fallout, or any other AAA title, and they are always suprised when they get Garry's mod as the answer. I grew up on this game. Days home from school "sick" , rainy weekends, normal afternoons.. I was always here. It was my routine. My comfort. TTT, surf, sandbox, a little prop hunt now and then...

Some of the best moments of my life came from this game. I know, i know. Pathetic right? But i've made some of the most important friendships i've ever had on this game. It was my home for 5 years. and i regret nothing. This game may seem simple and maybe even a little stupid. But that's the point y'know? a simple thing for you and possibly some friends, new or old enjoy. I miss it. I miss the good times. Hopefully this review will make someone buy it, and then they'll learn what i've been talking about. It's an amazing thing.

after I played this. I WAS HOOKED. The puzzles are amazing! I cant believe I slept on this game for so long. The ending so "still alive" is GREAT. Makes me wanna play that portal: still alive game. This is worth your money, if you like puzzles with portals that is.

Honestly this is probably one of the best series of games valve has made, being fun yet not too difficult. you've probably already played this or at least seen play through of it but if you somehow haven't please buy it, not only for the reason already said but also for how well built the puzzles are. the game is only like 2 hours long on first play through and maybe even under an hour if you know what your doing but its still a fun experience otherwise.

If you get easily dizzy with flipping camera angles I won't recommend it. Good game, quite short but fun. You could play it all in 1 sitting if you know the puzzles, if not it might take a few weeks. If you like puzzle games and like a challenge then i would say go for it. It's a game that i know i can always come back to just to play for a few hours no matter what. Once you finish the game there are challenge levels that you can play which are quite fun as well.
